sentences: Usu on oluline osa paljude inimeste elust.
context: In Estonian, 'usu' is the genitive singular form of the noun 'usk', which means faith or belief. It represents possession or association with faith/belief (e.g., 'of faith'). As a verb form, it's an inflection of 'uskuma' (to believe), specifically the present indicative connegative in second-person singular imperative form.
